Worth Â£56.99, the online delivery giant is offering this styling tool for just Â£19.99, reducing it by a staggering 65 percent and Â£37 overall. Offering a stylish, sleek black design, it uses a power 2200W motor that delivers fast, efficient styling, with three heat and two speed settings having shoppers saying that it provides "super versatile" styling options. Another key feature beauty buffs will love is the ionic conditioning that provides multiple benefits such as a faster drying time, all while leaving hair smoother, shinier and less damaged. Get this salon-results from home with this Amazon deal(Image: Remington) It also comes complete with a concentrator attachment that can help achieve that smooth, sleek effect, while the diffuser will be suitable for anyone looking to enhance their curls. With praise for its "fast drying" ability that also leaves hair "frizz free", it's understandable why it averages a 4.6 rating, as one shopper said: "Absolutely love this Remington hair dryer! It's not all about skincare, as the Gel Finish Nail Polish in the shade 'Orange Spice' will give a 'streak free' finish for those summer nails, while the Velvet Cloud Cream Blush and No7 Age Defying Lipstick finish the edit. â€‰ Donatella Versace has enlisted Kate Moss, Claudia Schiffer and more for her final campaign as creative director. The 70-year-old designer - who took on the position at Versace in 1997 following the murder of her brother Gianni Versace - will stepping into brand ambassador role with former Miu Miu design director Dario Vitale taking her place at the helm. As reported by Women's Wear Daily, she is a group of longtime Versace collaborators on board for her final fall 2025 campaign. As well as Schiffer and Moss, the campaign will also feature Kristen McMenamy, Amber Valletta, Natasha Poly, Saskia de Brauw, Liu Wen, Mica ArgaÃ±araz, Anok Yai, Mila Van Eeten and Jacqui Hooper. She said in a statement: â€œWith this campaign we tried to create something that gives a message of fun, love and looking forward. â€œIt's not only about the clothes, it's about the spirit that is on set. "These images were created with soul, they were created with friendship. "Every collection is a story, and this is the story of Versace, and I'm always ready for the next chapter.â€ The photoshoot has been handled by Mert and Marcus, who also have a longstanding connection to the brand. In March, it was confirmed Donatella was stepping down as creative director and moving into a different role. She said at the time: "Championing the next generation of designers has always been important to me. I am thrilled that Dario Vitale will be joining us, and excited to see Versace through new eyes. I want to thank my incredible design team and all the employees at Versace that I have had the privilege of working with for over three decades. "It has been the greatest honour of my life to carry on my brother Gianni's legacy. He was the true genius, but I hope I have some of his spirit and tenacity." Donatella vowed to "remain Versace's most passionate supporter". She added: "In my new role as Chief Brand Ambassador, I will remain Versace's most passionate supporter. Versace is in my DNA and always in my heart.â€ Capri Holdings, who bought Versace in 2018, explained the announcements were part of a "thoughtful succession plan". Chairman and CEO John D. Idol said: â€œToday's announcements were part of a thoughtful succession plan for Versace. Since 1997, Donatella has (...) played an integral role in the company's global success. â€œ[Vitale] is a strong design leader, and we are confident that his talent and vision will be instrumental to Versace's future growth.â€ The company added Donatella plans to "dedicate herself to the support of Versace's philanthropic and charitable endeavours and will remain an advocate for the brand globally".

â€‰ ZUMAPRESS.com / MEGA Just days after Lauren SÃ¡nchez 's over-the-top, star-studded wedding to Jeff Bezos in Venice, drama continues to unfold. Recent reports have revealed that one of the journalists' wedding outfits was stolen by an uninvited guest. In addition, it was also reported that another of SÃ¡nchez's dresses nearly caught fire, adding to the chaos of her and Bezos's big day. A Dress Gone Without A Trace  KCS Presse / MEGA In a shocking post-wedding twist, one of SÃ¡nchez's elaborate wedding outfits has mysteriously vanished. The stolen gown, part of a jaw-dropping 27-dress wardrobe curated for the three-day Venetian celebration, disappeared under curious circumstances. TheÂ  Daily Mail Â  cited a report from the Italian tabloid Â  Corriere della Sera , which stated that Â the dress was reported missing shortly after the lavish event. However, the specific designer behind the gown has not been publicly revealed. The alleged culprit is an elegantly dressed woman who reportedly slipped past tight security without an official invite. While she was â€œkindly escorted out,â€ her personal information wasn't recorded, and that's when the disappearance occurred. It is believed that this mysterious gatecrasher may have stolen one of the bride's gowns during the chaos of the weekend-long festivities. Lauren SÃ¡nchez's Dream Gown Nearly Catches Fire View this post on Instagram A post shared by Lauren SÃ¡nchez Bezos (@laurensanchezbezos) As if a stolen wedding dress wasn't enough, another of SÃ¡nchez's gowns nearly went up in flames. Reports claim that a Dolce & Gabbana gown intended for the ceremony caught fire at some point during the celebration. Thankfully, it wasn't the dress she wore to say â€œI do.â€ That particular gown, designed by Domenico Dolce himself, was a breathtaking masterpiece featuring a high lace turtleneck, floral sleeves, and a sweeping train. SÃ¡nchez dazzled guests as she walked down the aisle on the island of San Giorgio Maggiore in a luxurious ensemble, handpicked after a magical fitting in Milan. â€œIt was more powerful than I thought,â€ she told Vogue of the moment she tried it on for the first time, describing how the dress made her feel like a "princess." Lauren SÃ¡nchez Shared the Gown That Took Jeff Bezos' Breath Away View this post on Instagram A post shared by Lauren SÃ¡nchez Bezos (@laurensanchezbezos) Although Bezos reportedly begged to see the dress ahead of the ceremony, SÃ¡nchez stuck to tradition. â€œI almost gave in,â€ she admitted in the interview with Vogue . â€œBut I want it to be a surprise. As you get a little older, not many things surprise you. â€‰ Plus, other must-know industry news you may have missed Welcome to the Week in Fashion, Bazaar's at-a-glance guide to what the industry is talking about. Fendi reintroduced their iconic Spy Bag on Thursday with a cinematic digital campaign starring Amelia Gray, Xiao Wen Ju, and Gabbriette. The 30-second video, photographed and directed by Stevie Dance and styled by Anna Trevelyan, follows the storyline of an underground collector tracking down the coveted accessory. The original Spy Bag was launched by Silvia Venturini Fendi in 2005 and quickly became a defining accessory of the 2000s. The signature design now returns, 20 years after its original release. Spy Bags, both original and new, feature a plush silhouette, twisted handles, and secret compartments that offer privacy in style. The new iteration boasts a few contemporary updates that brings the feeling of Y2K to 2025. Donatella Versace, who announced she would be stepping down from her position as Chief Creative Officer early this spring, launched her final ad campaign this week, starring veteran muses Kate Moss, Kristen McMenamy, Amber Valletta, Natasha Poly, and Claudia Schiffer, as well as newer faces like Anok Yai and Mica ArgaÃ±araz. The images and retro video clip feature Donatella's final Fall 2025 collection, and was shot by long-time collaborators Mert & Marcus. Former Miu Miu creative director Dario Vitale will succeed Donatella and stage his debut Versace show in September. The campaign symbolized a passing of the torch to Vitale, honoring the Versace of the past while also celebrating what's to come. â€œIt was all about friendship, loyalty, and love. Every collection is a story, and this campaign is the story of Versace. Inspiring the present and anticipating the future,â€ Donatella said in a statement. Last week, Zimmermann's Cruise 2026 ready-to-wear Twisted Romance collection hit the streets of Mykonos for a corresponding digital runway show. This adventurous, pirate-inspired collection featured colorful stripes, dramatic corsets, voluminous sleeves, and billowing skirts. The vintage-inspired nautical designs looked at home on the cobblestone alleyways of the island, while the sea breeze showcased the water-like movement of the silk georgette. This isn't the first trip to Mykonos for the Australian brand. Zimmermann opened a boutique there in May and christened it with an exclusive â€œDinner at Seaâ€ on June 16. On Tuesday, The National Gallery of Victoria in Melbourne announced Westwood | Kawakubo, a major new exhibition featuring over 140 designs by fashion icons Vivienne Westwood and Rei Kawakubo of Comme des GarÃ§ons. The exhibit, opening with NGV's annual gala on December 6, marks the first time the work of these two designers will be shown together in a dedicated exhibition. The show will highlight key similarities and differences in the work of the two self-taught designers. Nearly 100 pieces have been drawn from the NGV Collection, alongside loans from major international institutions including the Met, Victoria & Albert Museum, Palais Galliera, and the Vivienne Westwood archive. The exhibition also includes over 40 recent Comme des GarÃ§ons works gifted to the NGV for this project. Westwood | Kawakubo continues NGV's history of major fashion exhibitions, following previous shows on Gabrielle Chanel, Alexander McQueen, Christian Dior, and Jean Paul Gaultier. Gucci officially named dancer, singer, and songwriter Lee Know, of the K-pop group Stray Kids, as its newest Global Brand Ambassador on Monday. Regarding his new role, he shared in a press release, â€œI believe Gucci is a brand that transcends the past and present through heritage and contemporary creativity. It's a great honor to be part of Gucci's visionary journey.â€ He has long incorporated the brand's designs into his personal style and has attended numerous Gucci events prior to the official partnership announcement, including the Cruise 2025 fashion show in London last year. As a Global Brand Ambassador, Know is set to participate in future events, campaigns, and initiatives for Gucci, joining other notable ambassadors like Robert Pattinson, Kendall Jenner, and Dakota Johnson. Bottega Veneta announced Italian tennis champion Lorenzo Musetti's new ambassadorship this week, following his participation in the house's recent 'Craft is our Language' campaign. The campaign celebrated 50 years of their signature Intrecciato weave handbags and accessories. He joined fellow Bottega Veneta ambassadors such as Tyler, the Creator, Jack Antonoff, Lauren Hutton, and Julianne Moore to highlight the importance of hand language in craftsmanship and art. Lorenzo's feature focused on the beauty of the hand motions used in tennis. Musetti was ranked No. 6 in the Association of Tennis Professionals singles rankings in 2025, reaching the semifinals of both the 2024 Wimbledon Championships and the 2025 French Open. Representing Italy, he won bronze in men's singles at the 2024 Paris Olympics and led the Italian national team to victory in the 2023 and 2024 Davis Cup championship.

â€‰ "Be yourself. Believe in yourself. Break the rules." â€” the pulsing spirit of the Fall Winter 2025 collection, embodying the House's enduring belief. Brought to life by Donatella Versace, and a formidable family of close collaborators and friends, in a campaign celebrating freedom and fearless self-expression. Together, a union of transcendent forces, fortified by their unwavering conviction and strength. "The energy on this campaign was extraordinary. It was all about friendship, loyalty, and love. These images were created to celebrate the soul of the Versace woman. Her strength, her spirit, her attitude, and her heart. Every collection is a story, and this campaign is the story of Versace. Inspiring the present and anticipating the future." â€” Donatella Versace Stood tall, in a powerful dialogue between FW25 and archival dressesâ€”iconic, definitively Versace silhouettes, formed of the House's signature metallic mesh. Sinuous and sculpted, like liquid gold, casting light on Versace's rule-breaking sensuality and innovation. A deep synergy with the new V-emblem, forged from metal, decorating the newly launched Virtus bag. A rounded, semi-circular top-handle style, speaking to Versace's inherent tensions; embodying the Versace woman's unyielding embracing of hard and soft. The campaign, captured by long-standing collaborators Mert and Marcus, is a definitive culmination of Donatella Versace's unparalleled vision, reaffirming the indelible legacy of the House while igniting the path forward. It stands as a proud celebration of Versace's uncompromising spirit, empowering unapologetic self-expression on the cusp of an exhilarating new chapter. Chief Creative Officer: Donatella Versace Photographers & Directors: Mert & Marcus Starring: Claudia Schiffer, Kate Moss, Kristen McMenamy, Amber Valletta, Natasha Poly, Saskia de Brauw, Liu Wen, Mica ArgaÃ±araz, Anok Yai, Mila Van Eeten, and Jacqui Hooper Stylist: Jacob K Makeup Artist: Lucia Pieroni Hair Stylist: Paul Hanlon

Estas leyendas aparecen junto al nombre de la fragancia, por lo general en francÃ©s. En caso de duda, tambiÃ©n se puede consultar el porcentaje de concentraciÃ³n en la lista de ingredientes. AdemÃ¡s, algunas marcas ofrecen el mismo aroma en diferentes concentraciones. Por ejemplo, Chanel Coco Mademoiselle tiene versiones tanto EDP cÃ³mo EDT, cada una con una estructura olfativa ligeramente distinta, pero fiel al ADN del perfume. Consideraciones al comprar en lÃ­nea Cuando se adquiere una fragancia por internet, especialmente en tiendas mexicanas como Liverpool, Sears, Sanborns o Amazon MÃ©xico, es fundamental verificar la descripciÃ³n del producto....

â€‰ Well, as you should know, a large fraction--but not majority--of people here purchase luxury handbags associated with Houses that have been in the industry for a *long* time. Your brand, unfortunately, won't reach a cult following any time soon; it takes decades to build and maintain that. So I would recommend you *not* rely on logo hardware or monograms of any sort. Every brand has a "story". It's a marketing tactic. I recommend you come up with one, and it doesn't have to be 100% true. You are welcome to embellish. You'd be surprised what a story can do. Chanel was a dying brand until Karl Lagerfeld took over. He reinvented the lore for the dying house and made Coco Chanel seem like the pinnacle of upper class from rags to riches (while simultaneously hiding her Nazi connections). What he did for the brand is immeasurable. Anyway, yeah, a good story always helps. Pick out your niche. What differentiates you from "other" handbag brands? Every brand is known for *something* . I wouldn't recommend going for "all our pieces are unique and handcrafted by the finest artisans" or "made with the higest quality leathers" as that has been over done and means very little to those actually into handbags. You need to pick a group--like age range and social economic status--you wish to appeal to. Have a distinct House code/style. You want to stick out. Having themes in your collection or iconic prints will help people recognise your product from afar. Think Chanel's quilted pattern, Burberry's Nova Check print, Versace's embellishments and safety pins, etc. All these repeat features help create world building, as we call it in the fashion world. Also, social media. I can't stress that enough.

â€‰ Marco d'Avanzo has appointed the Outerwear label K-Way as Chief International Business Officer. D'Avanzo announced this news about his LinkedIn profile. D'Avanzo started his new position at the originally French label at the beginning of the month, he announced on Tuesday at the LinkedIn career network. The manager is no stranger to the fashion industry. From October 2016 to April 2025 he was General Manager and Executive Vice President Global Sales at the Canadian luxury outwear provider Moose Knuckles. There he was responsible for the brand's international expansion, including the storage opening in Amsterdam. Before his time at Moose Knuckles, he was a sales manager at Woolrich for four years. Before that, he worked for several years as a sales manager at Guess Europe and Versace. D'Avanzo comes on board at a time when K-Way expands strongly. In March, Alessandro Boglione, VicePresident of the Italian parent company Basicnet, informed Fashionunited that several stores in the Netherlands, Belgium and Luxembourg are opened by collaboration with Fashion Club 70. The opening of the second branch in Antwerp followed a month later. K-Way operates more than 119 of its own stores worldwide. This article was used with digital tools translated. Fashionunited uses artificial intelligence to accelerate the translation of articles and improve the end result. They help us make the international reporting of fashionunited a German -speaking readership quickly and comprehensively accessible. â€‰ Two boys charged with a stabbing murder might have been hired for the hit before targeting the wrong man in a case police have labelled "disorganised crime". Luke Manassa was stabbed outside a house in Pemulwuy in Sydney's west on June 26 by two masked assailants armed with machetes who were lying in wait in the driveway. Mr Manassa tried to escape to his ute and drive away but only travelled a few hundred metres before being overcome by his injuries and dying at the scene. Two teenagers, aged 16 and 17, were due to face a children's court charged with murder on Friday. The pair were arrested on Thursday morning but cannot be identified due to their age. The 17-year-old was on bail when Mr Manassa was killed. Detective Superintendent Joseph Doueihi said the teens were known to police for past violent behaviour and association with street gangs. "We believe that these younger offenders were contracted by someone to conduct this killing," Det Supt Doueihi told reporters. But there was no evidence linking Mr Manassa's alleged killers to the wider spate of organised crime violence in Sydney. "It's a very amateurish offence by these offenders," Det Supt Doueihi said. "If anything, I'd call it disorganised crime." Mr Manassa's family are adamant he was not the intended victim and police confirmed he was not known to authorities prior to his death. He did not live at the house he arrived at when he was stabbed but visited there occasionally. "The occupants of that location are known to Luke and are also known to NSW Police," Det Supt Doueihi said. Police have seized a red Kia the teens allegedly used to flee the scene. The pair are the latest in a string of young people allegedly caught up in Sydney's organised crime wave. On Wednesday, two 15-year-old boys were charged over two shootings in Sydney's southwest in June, one of which also involved a potential case of mistaken identity. "The problem is that these young children don't understand the consequences of their actions," Det Supt Doueihi said. "They could end up dead themselves, or they could be victims of some form of retaliation by the people that they tried to target." The killing of plumber John Versace at Condell Park in May was another high-profile case of suspected mistaken identity.

â€‰ Donatella Versace has revealed her final campaign as Chief Creative Officer for Versace. Under the title â€œA Celebration of Freedom, Strength, Power.â€ The Fall-Winter 2025 campaign highlights the fashion house's ongoing emphasis on individuality and rule-breaking confidence, with a focus on female strength, attitude and heart. It features a notable line-up of iconic faces from the industry, including Claudia Schiffer, Kate Moss, Kristen McMenamy, Amber Valletta, Natasha Poly, Saskia de Brauw, Liu Wen, Mica ArgaÃ±araz, Anok Yai, Mila Van Eeten and Jacqui Hooper. Photographers and directors Mert and Marcus, long-time collaborators with the House, were behind the visuals. According to Donatella Versace, the campaign was driven by energy and friendship. â€œThe energy on this campaign was extraordinary. It was all about friendship, loyalty, and love. These images were created to celebrate the soul of the Versace woman. Her strength, her spirit, her attitude, and her heart. Every collection is a story, and this campaign is the story of Versace. Inspiring the present and anticipating the future,â€ she said. The campaign bridges elements of the Fall-Winter 2025 collection and iconic archival designs. It features definitive Versace silhouettes alongside signature metallic mesh fabrics. The new Virtus bag is central to the collection's identity, incorporating a bold V-emblem formed from metal and a semi-circular top handle, intended to echo the tension and duality within the Versace woman. Stylist Jacob K helped to create the campaign's aesthetic, with Lucia Pieroni handling makeup artistry and Paul Hanlon responsible for hair styling. Versace stated that the collection and campaign aim to showcase the merging of hard and soft, strength and sensuality. The designs continue the brand's tradition of blending boldness with innovation, while remaining anchored in its signature codes. With this campaign, Versace reasserts its commitment to empowering women and celebrating authentic self-expression. It also marks a new chapter for the House, which continues to build on its legacy while looking firmly to the future. versace.com The post appeared first on A&E Magazine .

â€‰ Kate Moss stars in Versace's fall-winter 2025 campaign. Photo: Mert & Marcus / Versace Power. Print. Provocation. Donatella Versace signs off with a bang in her final campaign for Versace's fall 2025 season. This is the house she transformed into a kingdom of unapologetic glam. Shot by Mert & Marcus and styled to glossy perfection by Jacob K, the collection delivers pure opulence: baroque swirls, leopard lust, and leathered edge. Versace Fall/Winter 2025 Campaign Anok Yai fronts Versace's fall-winter 2025 campaign. Photo: Mert & Marcus / Versace Claudia Schiffer is statuesque in a body-hugging printed catsuit, layered over sheer black. It's gilded, belted, and dripping in gold. Kate Moss reclaims her crown in a barely-there leopard romper with fingerless gloves and defiant ease. Anok Yai brings regality in a cocoon-like puffer, wrapped in red, gold, and animal print. Claudia Schiffer appears in Versace's fall-winter 2025 campaign. Photo: Mert & Marcus / Versace Kristen McMenamy's icy platinum presence stuns in a tailored trench and flame-red ruffles, while Amber Valletta, Natasha Poly, Saskia de Brauw, Liu Wen, Mica ArgaÃ±araz, Mila Van Eeten, and Jacqui Hooper round out this Versace model sisterhood with commanding poise. Mica ArgaÃ±araz poses in Versace's fall-winter 2025 campaign. Photo: Mert & Marcus / Versace â€œThese images were created to celebrate the soul of the Versace woman. Her strength, her spirit, her attitude, and her heart. Every collection is a story, and this campaign is the story of Versace,â€ Donatella shares.

â€‰ SPR_COMBO[it]video suggerito 4 Luglio 2025 12:49 Il matrimonio di Jeff Bezos e Lauren Sanchez ha creato un certo movimento nel mondo della moda.Â  Alcuni brand in particolare hanno guadagnato visibilitÃ . 0 CONDIVISIONI Il matrimonio di Jeff Bezos e Lauren Sanchez ha catalizzato l'attenzione del mondo intero: la coppia si Ã¨ sposata a Venezia e avrebbe speso secondo le stime 20 milioni di euroÂ tra location, misure di sicurezza., catering, vestiti e quant'altro. A proposito proprio di vestiti: la sposa non si Ã¨ certo limitata. Ha anzi portato con sÃ© ben 27 abiti, da sfoggiare nell'arco dei tre giorni di sfarzosissimi e lussuosi festeggiamenti. Si Ã¨ rivolta a diverse importanti Maison e come lei anche gli invitati. Tutto questo ha creato un certo movimento nel mondo della moda. Gli abiti del matrimonio di Lauren Sanchez e Jeff Bezos La sposa nel fatidico giorno del sÃ¬ ha scelto una creazione firmata Dolce&Gabbana: un abito a sirenaÂ ispirato a Sofia Loren, in omaggio proprio all'Italia, che ha ospitato le nozze (e anche la luna di miele visto che ora i neo sposi sono in Sicilia). Tra gli altri brand a cui si Ã¨ affidata: Alexander McQueen (il monospalla del primo giorno), Schiaparelli (un capo d'Alta Moda da circa 100mila euro), Alaia, Dior, Versace. Non sono mancati gli imprevisti: pare infatti che un vestito sia scomparso, forse rubato. E che dire dei look degli invitati. La guest list, top secret fino all'ultimo, includeva ospiti provenienti da ogni parte del mondo. C'erano Vittoria Ceretti con Leonardo Di Caprio, la regina Rania di Giordania, Kylie e Kendall Jenner, Kim Kardashian, Sydney Sweeney. Proprio l'attrice ha riscosso particolare successo coi suoi outfit. Lauren SÃ nchez in Schiaparelli Haute Couture Quali brand hanno guadagnato di piÃ¹ dalle nozze Secondo un report di Launchmetrics riportato da WWD, il matrimonio dell'imprenditore (fondatore e proprietario di Amazon) e della giornalista avrebbe prodotto ben 222 milioni di dollari di Media Impact Value (MIV). Sul fronte moda, pare ne abbia beneficiato soprattutto Dolce&Gabbana (avendo firmato l'abito bianco): si parla di una visibilitÃ  mediatica del valore di 14,5 milioni di dollari e di un incremento del 28% in quanto a esposizione mediatica nei giorni dell'evento. Il brand, tra l'altro, non ha vestito solo la sposa ma anche alcuni invitati: Vittoria Ceretti, Kylie Jenner, Sydney Sweeney. Il look Versace di Lauren Sanchez per il party Dolce Notte Bene anche per Schiaparelli, che ha realizzato il look del party pre nozze: ha generato 4 milioni di dollari, seguito da Versace che ha pensato al look post matrimonio con 2,8 milioni. Nella classifica stilata da Launchmetrics compaiono anche Alexander McQueen, Dilara Findikoglu (che ha vestito le sorelle Kardashian), Roberto Cavalli, la designer di gioielli Lorraine Schwartz e Tom Ford. Sydney Sweeney in Galia Lahav E che dire di Galia Lahav. Il brand ha firmato il look personalizzato di Sydney Sweeney per l'evento finale del sabato sera: l'abito da 25.000 dollari realizzato in 150 ore di lavoro ha avuto un impatto molto positivo per il brand. Come riporta WWD, il marchio avrebbe registrato un aumento addirittura del 200% nelle vendite e-commerce in sole 24 ore, ricevendo piÃ¹ di 80 richieste specifiche per l'abito dell'attrice. Sydney Sweeney in Galia Lahav Il responsabile globale delle PR, Yael Friedman, ha dichiarato: "L'esposizione ha generato un netto aumento di appuntamenti con le clienti e un fortissimo engagement sui social media. Ãˆ stato un esempio perfetto di come un look audace e di grande visibilitÃ  possa aumentare la desiderabilitÃ  e la brand awareness, oltre a portare risultati commerciali tangibili". 0 CONDIVISIONI

â€‰ The former Spice Girl's wedding dress had to be flown across the Atlantic four times to be perfectly fitted NEED TO KNOW Victoria Beckham and David Beckham got married 26 years ago on July 4, 1999 The fashion designer wore a champagne dress made by Vera Wang before changing into matching purple ensembles with David The dress featured a 20-foot train and a sculpted neckline Victoria Beckham is an undisputed style icon, and her 1999 wedding gown just might be one of her most memorable looks. On July 4, 1999, Victoria married soccer star David Beckham at the Luttrellstown Castle near Dublin. While David wore a chic white suit, Victoria opted for a stunning champagne ball gown made by iconic bridal designer Vera Wang. The silk pleated dress featured a 20-foot train and a sculpted, strapless neckline. To top off the look, Victoria accessorized the ensemble with an 18-karat gold tiara by jewelry designer Slim Barrett. Although the couple later ditched their white ceremony outfits in favor of matching purple getups for their reception, Victoria's wedding dress remains one of the most iconic staples from their lavish wedding and in her fashion lookbook as a whole. From details on the tiara to how that cinched bodice was made, here's everything to know about Victoria Beckham's wedding dress. The corset was made by Mister Pearl David Beckham and Victoria Beckham on their wedding day. David Beckham/Instagram One of couture's most celebrated corsetieres, Mister Pearl designed the underbodice for Victoria's wedding dress, which helped augment the structural top half of her ensemble. â€œThe actual underbodice was made by a very famous couture corsetiere named Mister Pearl, who works only out of London,â€ Wang told PEOPLE in 2023. â€œHe makes corsets that have to be pulled [in] with these metal things, which is how corsets were done in the old days.â€ Mister Pearl has worked with a slew of designers throughout his career, including Thierry Mugler and Vivienne Westwood. He also famously created Kim Kardashian's cinched corset for her iconic 2019 Met Gala look. The fashion entrepreneur joked in a red carpet interview with Vogue that she wasn't sure if she could take a â€œdeep breathâ€ while wearing the staple piece. â€œIt takes about 45 minutes to lace up,â€ Wang added of Mister Pearl's unique corsets. â€œAnd it can take your waist down to literally 18 inches [like] Scarlett O'Hara.â€ The gown flew across the Atlantic four times David and Victoria Beckham during their wedding in 1999. Victoria Beckham/ Instagram Since Mister Pearl exclusively works out of England, Victoria's dress â€” specifically its sculpted bodice â€” had to fly back and forth between New York City and London. â€œI call it the transatlantic dress,â€ Wang told PEOPLE, adding that the bodice had to fly four times across the pond. Wang flew out to London to help fit the corset onto Victoria, and the former Spice Girl also had to visit New York twice for more fittings. Things took a pause, however, when Victoria became pregnant with her and David's firstborn,Â Brooklyn. â€œSo then we delayed the wedding for two years,â€ Wang said. â€œThen we resumed, or maybe a year and a half. So that is [what] I call the transatlantic wedding with Victoria and David.â€ The designer also fondly remembered a baby Brooklyn â€œcrawling around on the bed in Londonâ€ during the fittings. Her tiara was decorated with brilliant-cut diamonds David Beckham and Victoria Adams Beckham hug on their wedding day. David Backham/ Instagram Victoria topped off her bridal ensemble with an iconic staple piece â€” an 18-karat gold tiara. To create the gorgeous headpiece, the Spice World star tapped jewelry designer Slim Barrett, who has collaborated with fashion houses like Chanel and Versace throughout his career and designed pieces for Mick Jagger and Princess Diana. The tiara, named the â€œEast of Paris,â€ was made from 18-carat latticed gold and adorned with brilliant-cut diamonds and suspended diamond drops. After the wedding, Barrett kept the crown, and it was later displayed at the Victoria and Albert Museum in London for its 100 Tiaras, Past and Present show. Barrett eventually put up the tiara for auction in 2013 at Bonhams in London, where it was valued between 18,000 and 25,000 pounds. â€œInspiration for East of Paris came from my love of Eastern design and Parisian haute couture,â€ Barrett told British Vogue at the time. â€œI set out to fuse the two styles.â€ Victoria still has her wedding dress David Beckham and Victoria Adams Beckham on their wedding day. David Beckham/ Instagram Years after their wedding, Victoria has held onto her gown. In a 2018 video for British Vogue, the fashion designer whipped out the wedding dress to honor her brand's 10th anniversary and to celebrate her life in looks. â€œToday we're here at Vogue and we are shooting a cover story celebrating the rich and inspiring history of one of the most enduring style icons of all time â€¦ me, Victoria Beckham,â€ she joked at the start of the video....

â€‰ By the early '90s, Helena Christensen wasn't just a model, she was a Super. Alongside Naomi, Linda, Christy, and Cindy, Helena helped redefine what it meant to be a model: not just a face, but a force. She walked for Chanel, Versace, Valentino, and fronted campaigns that shaped fashion history. But beyond the glitter and glamour, Helena's journey has always been guided by intuition, instinct, and an insatiable curiosity about the world. â€œI didn't plan far ahead,â€ she tells @itsmeanitab. â€œI kind of just floated along, but was deeply connected to how I felt deep down in my stomach.â€ Now, decades into an inimitable career, she opens up about quiet reinvention, the grace and freedom of mid-life, and why this era might just be her most meaningful yet. Read the full story at the link in bio. â€‰ âœ¨Friday Feature Fog and Fury (Haven Thriller 1) by Rachel Howzell Hall Huge Thank you to booksparks for the free book and allowing me to be a summer ambassador! #SRC2025 Wrapping up the selections is a small town death that's questioned by a tenacious private investigator. Sound good? Check out the synopsis! After ten years on the force, LAPD cop Sonny Rush relocates with her elderly mother to peaceful Haven, California, to join her godfather's burgeoning PI business. What crimes could possibly happen in a town nicknamed â€œMayberry by the Seaâ€? Sonny's first case: find Figgy, a missing goldendoodle last seen sporting a Versace collar. At least scouting out a dognapper gives Sonny a chance to get to know her new neighbors. Forty-eight hours in town and Figgy's disappearance entangles Sonny in an unwelcome reunion with her ex, one of Haven's wealthiest citizens. And when the body of a teenage boy is found along a popular hiking trail, Sonny is drawn into a web of strange beyond anything she ever saw in LA. Then comes a local's warning: question everything. Haven hides secrets that could destroy its idyllic facade. Or destroy Sonny first. Any fun weekend plans? What's your current read? #FogAngFury #RachelHowzellHall #MysteryBooks #SummerReading #BiblioPeeks 2025 new books about small town murder mystery bipoc reads book recs recommendations

â€‰ Kim Kardashian may have peaced out from Venice, but she's not done sharing content from Jeff Bezos and Lauren SÃ¡nchez's over-the-top wedding weekend. Kim Kardashian/Instagram There's no keeping up with these jewels. Days after attending Jeff Bezos and Lauren SÃ¡nchez's $50 million wedding in Venice, Kim Kardashian's continuing to treat her Instagram followers to content from the star-studded weekend. On Thursday, the Skims co-founder shared snaps of her and sister KhloÃ©'s looks for the ceremony: an intricately embellished brown vintage Versace gown and a pink sequined Tamara Ralph Couture dress topped with a matching feathered cape, respectively. On Thursday, the Skims co-founder shared snaps of her and sister KhloÃ©'s looks for the wedding ceremony. Kim Kardashian/Instagram Kim wore vintage Versace, while KhloÃ© was clad in Tamara Ralph Couture. Kim Kardashian/Instagram Explore More But we couldn't take our eyes off Kim's jaw-dropping gems from Moussaieff, which the star made sure to capture in several close-up shots. She wore not one, but two over-the-top necklaces, per the jeweler: a 105.69-carat multicolored diamond style suspended with a 50.46-carat fancy light yellow-brown diamond pendant, and a 63.23-carat white diamond design. Kim's neck wasn't the only thing dripping in precious jewels; she also wore earrings set with two pear-cut fancy deep orange-brown diamonds weighing in at just over 35 carats each and framed by 6.43 carats of white diamonds. Kim wore not one, but two over-the-top diamond necklaces from Moussaieff. Kim Kardashian/Instagram Together, the two necklaces were set with more than 200 carats of sparkling stones. Kim Kardashian/Instagram And the mogul finished off her look with a duo of Moussaieff rings, one featuring an 18.51-carat fancy dark orange-brown diamond and the other with a 22.99-carat fancy yellow-brown diamond. KhloÃ© â€”Â along with family members Kendall, Kylie and Kris, who also attended the wedding â€”Â opted for pieces from Lorraine Schwartz. The Good American co-founder went for a dramatic diamond drop necklace set with six massive pear-cut stones in the center, while Kendall picked an emerald necklace-and-earring set that popped against her sheer black Tom Ford gown. KhloÃ©, Kendall, Kylie and Kris all wore Lorraine Schwartz jewelry. Kim Kardashian/Instagram It would've been impossible to outshine the bride, though; SÃ¡nchez was dripping in diamonds throughout her wedding weekend, too. Nicolas Geradin And Kylie selected an array of white diamond pieces to complement her polarizing icy blue Dilara Findikoglu corset dress. Still, not even the Kardashian-Jenners could compete with the bride's bling. In addition to pairing her $2.5 million pink diamond ring from Bezos with an oval-cut Lorraine Schwartz rock seemingly twice the size, SÃ¡nchez was also gifted a multimillion-dollar diamond necklace from the Amazon founder before their big day, as Page Six exclusively reported.

On July 3, the brand unveiled the images for its latest campaign â€” the last with Donatella as the head of the fashion house, as she will officially step aside as the brand's chief creative officer to become its chief brand ambassador. Versace marked the end of one of fashion's most defining eras by including multiple iconic supermodels in the campaign, including Kate Moss, Claudia Schiffer, Anok Yai, Kristen McMenamy, Amber Valletta and more. In a press release, Donatella, 70, said the "energy" on the campaign was "extraordinary." Mert & Marcus/Versace Kate Moss "It was all about friendship, loyalty, and love. These images were created to celebrate the soul of the Versace woman," she added. "Her strength, her spirit, her attitude, and her heart. Every collection is a story, and this campaign is the story of Versace. Inspiring the present and anticipating the future.â€ Natasha Poly, Saskia de Brauw, Liu Wen, Mica ArgaÃ±araz, Mila Van Eeten and Jacqui Hooper are also featured in the campaign, which was captured by long-standing collaborators Mert and Marcus. Mert & Marcus/Versace Claudia Shiffer According to Versace, the campaign functions as "a powerful dialogue between FW25 and archival dressesâ€”iconic, definitively Versace silhouettes, formed of the House's signature metallic mesh." Donatella took over Versace following the 1997 murder of her brother Gianni Versace and has since been instrumental in shaping the label's identity in the modern era. Her tenure saw the brand expand its global reach while staying true to its signature bold, glamorous and unapologetically sexy aesthetic. On July 3, the brand unveiled the images for its latest campaign â€” the last with Donatella as the head of the fashion house, as she will officially step aside as the brand's chief creative officer to become its chief brand ambassador. Versace marked the end of one of fashion's most defining eras by including multiple iconic supermodels in the campaign, including Kate Moss, Claudia Schiffer, Anok Yai, Kristen McMenamy, Amber Valletta and more. In a press release, Donatella, 70, said the "energy" on the campaign was "extraordinary." Mert & Marcus/Versace Kate Moss "It was all about friendship, loyalty, and love. These images were created to celebrate the soul of the Versace woman," she added. "Her strength, her spirit, her attitude, and her heart. Every collection is a story, and this campaign is the story of Versace. Inspiring the present and anticipating the future.â€ Natasha Poly, Saskia de Brauw, Liu Wen, Mica ArgaÃ±araz, Mila Van Eeten and Jacqui Hooper are also featured in the campaign, which was captured by long-standing collaborators Mert and Marcus. Mert & Marcus/Versace Claudia Shiffer According to Versace, the campaign functions as "a powerful dialogue between FW25 and archival dressesâ€”iconic, definitively Versace silhouettes, formed of the House's signature metallic mesh." Donatella took over Versace following theÂ 1997 murder of her brotherÂ Gianni Versace and has since been instrumental in shaping the label's identity in the modern era. Her tenure saw the brand expand its global reach while staying true to its signature bold, glamorous and unapologetically sexy aesthetic. â€‰ Invest UP to host business roundtables in major US and European cities, targeting tech, manufacturing and consumer giants The Uttar Pradesh government is taking its investment pitch global, anchoring a 'China+1' strategy to position the state as a dependable alternative for companies seeking to diversify supply chains. Under the banner of Invest UP, high-level roadshows and business roundtables will be held in New York, San Francisco, Los Angeles, London, Paris, Frankfurt, Milan, Amsterdam and Birmingham, in partnership with Indian embassies and industry bodies such as USIBC, CII and FICCI. In the United States, discussions will target technology heavyweights like , Amazon Web Services, Azure and , as well as datacenter operators Equinix and consumer brands including Skechers, Mattel, Ralph Lauren and Coach. In Europe and the UK, the outreach focuses on automotive and engineering leaders BMW, Bosch and BASF, luxury houses Prada and Versace, and consumer staples firms such as Lego, Unilever and GSK. Chief Secretary Manoj Kumar Singh said these engagements go beyond mere investment invitations, aiming to build sustainable, employment-driven value chains. Backed by over 33 sector-specific policies, streamlined approvals and the digital single-window platform Nivesh Mitra, UP recorded the highest number of new factory registrations in India in 2024â€“25, he noted. Singh highlighted recent marquee investments: a â‚¹3,700 crore semiconductor and electronics facility by - OSAT; the establishment of a Prime Minister's MITRA mega textile park alongside ten mini clusters; the 2023 EV policy targeting 36 GWh of battery capacity by 2028; and the development of Noidaâ€“Greater Noida as a national hub for data centres and AI infrastructure. Together, these initiatives set Uttar Pradesh on course to become a global manufacturing and innovation powerhouse. Stay updated with the latest -

â€‰ Lucknow: The Uttar Pradesh govt is all set to roll out an aggressive global outreach to position itself as a strong and reliable alternative for international investors. "Anchored around the ï¿½â‚¬ËœChina+1' strategy, Invest UP is set to conduct high-level roadshows and business roundtables across the US, UK, and Europe to attract companies seeking to diversify their supply chains away from China," said an official spokesperson on Friday. As part of the strategy, business to govt meetings will be held in key global cities, including New York, San Francisco, Los Angeles, London, Paris, Frankfurt, Milan, Amsterdam, and Birmingham. "These events are being organised in collaboration with Indian embassies and leading industry bodies, including the USIBC, CII, and FICCI," the spokeperson said. Officials concerned pointed out that in the US, dialogues will be held with companies such as Google, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Oracle, Equinix, Skechers, Mattel, Ralph Lauren, and Coach. In Europe and the UK, efforts will focus on attracting global giants like BMW, Bosch, BASF, Prada, Versace, Lego, Unilever, and GSK. In the context of shifting geopolitical dynamics and evolving global supply chains, Uttar Pradesh is emerging as a viable alternative to nations like Vietnam and Bangladesh. With world-class infrastructure, targeted sectoral incentives, and India's largest consumer base, the state offers an unmatched investment proposition. Chief secretary Manoj Kumar Singh emphasised that UP is not just inviting investment, but building sustainable, employment-driven value chains. "The state's 33+ sector-specific policies, streamlined approvals, and digital single-window system, Nivesh Mitra, are accelerating investor confidence," he said adding that in 2024ï¿½â‚¬â€œ25, UP recorded the highest number of new factory registrations in the country, signalling its growing appeal. These strategic efforts are setting the stage for Uttar Pradesh to emerge as a global manufacturing and innovation hub. For Reprint Rights: timescontent.com

â€‰ Tia Lee Graces the Cover of ELLE Malaysia: A Journey of Empowerment, Evolution, and Expression The feature comes on the heels of her massive success with "Goodbye Princess," which has surpassed 174 million views on YouTube â€” a testament to her global resonance and emotional storytelling. "Goodbye Princess" â€“ Her Personal Anthem Among her discography, "Goodbye Princess" holds a special place. "This song reflects my emotional journey â€” from someone who used to hesitate to express herself to someone who can now be more at ease and confident in being who she truly is." Beyond music, the accompanying visuals and campaign became a cornerstone of her #EmpowerHer movement, which supports real-world empowerment for women by providing employment support and helping them rebuild their confidence. Empowerment Through Art and Action For Tia, music is a powerful vessel to communicate strength and self-discovery. "Right now, I want to express the sense of empowerment girls can find during their growth journey," she said. Her #EmpowerHer initiative, born during the creative process of "Goodbye Princess," channels proceeds and awareness toward tangible support for women facing societal pressures and stereotypes. "Small efforts, when multiplied over 365 days, can grow into something significant," she said. "Empowerment begins when we help one another rise â€” especially during tough times." A Style Icon with Substance Beyond music, Tia continues to shape global fashion discourse. Describing her style as "minimalism, comfort, and soft personality," she values timelessness and quality, often opting for classic silhouettes in neutral tones. Her fashion inspiration? Rosie Huntington-Whiteley â€” a woman she admires for her strength, elegance, and purpose. Tia's passion for fashion is on full display in her ELLE Malaysia cover story, where she dons looks from Louis Vuitton, FENDI, Brunello Cucinelli, LOEWE, Ferragamo, Shu Shu Tong, TODS and Versace. This latest cover adds to her impressive roster of features on Vogue, Marie Claire, Harper's Bazaar, Rollercoaster, Flaunt Magazine, ICON, tmrw, and Grazia. Looking Forward: Healing, Self-Discovery, and Staying Grounded In today's fast-paced world, Tia prioritizes healing and self-understanding through activities like painting, meditation, and flower arranging. "You have to be honest with yourself and know what you need in order to grow into the person you want to be," she said. "Progress over perfection â€” that's what I live by." From creating art that touches hearts to advocating for societal change, Tia Lee continues to shape the cultural landscapeâ€”on her own terms, and always with a message of strength and sincerity. â€‰ Their triumph at the 2022 Euros turned England's Lionesses from little-known footballers into national heroines. And if the tournament made them famous, it also transformed their lives off the pitch. From lucrative brand ambassadorships with high-end fashion labels such as Gucci to turns on the red carpet in dresses worthy of a Kardashian, England's female footballers now enjoy more than a touch of glitz and glamour. Once badly paid and barely recognised â€“ who could forget goalie Mary Earps complaining before the last Euros that Nike hadn't even bothered to print replica shirts with her name on them â€“ the nation's female footballers now have a soaring commercial appeal. So as they prepare to face France at 8pm tonight in their first game of this year's Euros â€“ and inspire a new generation of young women with their sporting prowess â€“ Molly Clayton reveals which of our Lionesses enjoys the most luxurious lifestyle. The Gucci model Shoots for Vogue, GQ and Elle Magazine. Modelling for Calvin Klein. Gucci snapping her up as a brand ambassador. Clearly, as well as being an impressive England captain, Leah Williamson, 28, has a catwalk-worthy fashion career too. One of the biggest earners off the pitch after leading the Lionesses to victory at the Euro 2022 final, the blonde beauty has a deal with Nike and has collaborated with global brands such as Aston Martin, Pepsi, Walkers and Mastercard. With 1.1 million Instagram followers, she has new advert partnerships with Weetabix and Cadbury, along with six children's books, titled The Wonder Team. With the deals comes the gloss: her recent lavish Mallorcan holiday to an Ikos resort would have set her back in the region of Â£1,000 a night. She is rumoured to be dating former model and Miss USA Elle Smith â€“ both have posted about each other on social media. Ella the business brainbox With her ever-present fake eyelashes and love of make-up, Manchester United midfielder Ella Toone, 25, often showcases her beauty routine on her own YouTube channel. And with a canny business acumen to boot, Ella has already shaped an enviable off-pitch career. The first England women's player to trademark her name, she's set up her own brand, ET7, which includes a football academy for young girls. The name is inspired by her childhood hero, Portuguese footballing superstar Cristiano Ronaldo, whose own brand is called CR7. With some estimating her worth at more than Â£1 million, last month she set up her own creative agency, Amicizia, which aims to connect female athletes to commercial and marketing opportunities with top brands. Her sponsors include make-up company Charlotte Tilbury, orthodontic brand Invisalign and McDonald's, with her yearly earnings estimated as upwards of Â£200,000, fuelled by her popularity on social media. At one point, she was one of the top five most viewed athletes on TikTok. Ella has 737,000 Instagram followers and her own BBC podcast with best friend and fellow Lioness Alessia Russo, with whom she has appeared on the front cover of fashion and beauty magazine Elle. Ella loves nothing more than a red carpet bash. In a relationship with footballer Joe Bunney of Stalybridge Celtic FC, she regularly treats her fans to glimpses of their lavish holidays abroad and spa days at five-star hotels. Lauren's ooh la la lego Proving that every passion can be profitable, Manchester City forward Lauren Hemp, 24, has topped up her estimated Â£400,000 salary with a sponsorship deal with Lego. Devoted to creating Lego masterpieces in her downtime, saying it's 'the best way to relax', she's even made the Mona Lisa out of the bricks. Her other sponsors include Nike and Sports Direct. Lauren also has the support of her girlfriend, former Liverpool midfielder Ashley Hodson. Together for two years, the pair recently enjoyed a romantic trip to Paris, where Lauren saw the Mona Lisa in her more traditional setting. Shy superstar with an ex on the team Growing up, Lucy Bronze lived on Lindisfarne â€“ also known as Holy Island â€“ off the windswept coast of Northumberland. Her grandmother was caretaker of Lindisfarne Castle and today the outline of that building is tattooed on Lucy's wrist. Shy into adulthood, she was diagnosed with ADHD and autism in 2021. But neither her isolated upbringing nor her neurodiversity held her back. Rather, she's said she uses the intense focus associated with her conditions to her advantage â€“ and now the 33-year-old is one of the biggest earners in the game. She reportedly took home Â£200,000 a year while playing at Barcelona before her move to Chelsea in 2024. Big money deals followed her triumph at the last Euros, with Pepsi, EE, Klarna and Visa among her backers. Her former girlfriend is fellow Lioness Keira Walsh. Fashion week regular She earned almost Â£2 million in 2023 alone, according to Forbes magazine. That same year, Alessia Russo's transfer from Manchester United to Arsenal made her one of the most expensive female footballers on the planet. Her contract is said to be worth more than Â£500,000 a year and her commercial appeal is just as lucrative. She has deals with Gucci, Adidas, PlayStation, Beats by Dr Dre and last month was gifted an MGS5 EV car, which she proudly showed off on Instagram. A regular at London Fashion Week, Alessia, 26, has appeared on the cover of magazines such as Women's Health. The BAFTA TV Awards in May saw her in a Â£1,295 Roland Mouret dress, right. Revealing outfits... on pitch too! Hair scraped back and with braces on her teeth, Chloe Kelly scored that late winning goal against Germany at Wembley in 2022, famously taking off her top in celebration. Since then, she has revelled in her success with a glossy makeover....

â€‰ Lucknow: The Uttar Pradesh   govt is all set to roll out an aggressive global outreach   to position itself as a strong and reliable alternative   for international investors. â‚¬Å“Anchored around the 'China+1' strategy, Invest UP is set to conduct high-level roadshows   and business roundtables   across the US, UK, and Europe to attract companies seeking to diversify their supply chains away from China,ï¿½â‚¬   said an official spokesperson   on Friday. As part of the strategy, business   to govt meetings will be held in key global cities, including   New York, San Francisco,   Los Angeles, London, Paris, Frankfurt, Milan, Amsterdam, and Birmingham. â‚¬Å“These events are being organised in collaboration with Indian embassies and leading   industry bodies, including   the USIBC, CII, and FICCI,ï¿½â‚¬ the spokeperson said. Officials concerned pointed   out that in the US, dialogues   will be held with companies   such as Google, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure,   Oracle, Equinix, Skechers,   Mattel, Ralph Lauren, and Coach. In Europe and the UK, efforts will focus on attracting   global giants like BMW, Bosch, BASF, Prada, Versace, Lego, Unilever, and GSK. In the context of shifting geopolitical dynamics and evolving global supply chains,   Uttar Pradesh is emerging   as a viable alternative to nations like Vietnam and Bangladesh. With worldclass   infrastructure, targeted sectoral incentives, and India's   largest consumer base, the state offers an unmatched investment   proposition. Chief secretary Manoj Kumar Singh emphasised that UP is not just inviting investment,   but building sustainable,   employment-driven value chains.

â€‰ THE GUCCI MODEL SHOOTS for Vogue, GQ and Elle Magazine. Modelling for Calvin Klein. Gucci snapping her up as a brand ambassador. Clearly, as well as being an impressive England captain, Leah Williamson, 28, has a catwalk-worthy fashion career too. One of the biggest earners off the pitch after leading the Lionesses to victory at the Euro 2022 final, the blonde beauty has a deal with Nike and has collaborated with global brands such as Aston Martin, Pepsi, Walkers and Mastercard. With 1.1 million Instagram followers, she has new advert partnerships with Weetabix and Cadbury, along with six children's books, titled The Wonder Team. With the deals comes the gloss: her recent lavish Mallorcan holiday to an Ikos resort would have set her back in the region of Â£1,000 a night. She is rumoured to be dating former model and Miss USA Elle Smith - both have posted about each other on social media. LAUREN'S OOH LA LA LEGO PROVING that every passion can be profitable, Manchester City forward Lauren Hemp, 24, has topped up her estimated Â£400,000 salary with a sponsorship deal with Lego. Devoted to creating Lego masterpieces in her downtime, saying it's 'the best way to relax', she's even made the Mona Lisa out of the bricks. Her other sponsors include Nike and Sports Direct. Lauren also has the support of her girlfriend, former Liverpool midfielder Ashley Hodson. Together for two years, the pair recently enjoyed a romantic trip to Paris, where Lauren saw the Mona Lisa in her more traditional setting. SHY SUPERSTAR WITH AN EX ON THE TEAM GROWING up, Lucy Bronze lived on Lindisfarne - also known as Holy Island - off the windswept coast of Northumberland. Her grandmother was caretaker of Lindisfarne Castle and today the outline of that building is tattooed on Lucy's wrist. Shy into adulthood, she was diagnosed with ADHD and autism in 2021. But neither her isolated upbringing nor her neurodiversity held her back. Rather, she's said she uses the intense focus associated with her conditions to her advantage - and now the 33-year-old is one of the biggest earners in the game. She reportedly took home Â£200,000 a year while playing at Barcelona before her move to Chelsea in 2024. Big money deals followed her triumph at the last Euros, with Pepsi, EE, Klarna and Visa among her backers. Her former girlfriend is fellow Lioness Keira Walsh. FASHION WEEK REGULAR SHE earned almost Â£2million in 2023 alone, according to Forbes magazine. That same year, Alessia Russo's transfer from Manchester United to Arsenal made her one of the most expensive female footballers on the planet. Her contract is said to be worth more than Â£500,000 a year and her commercial appeal is just as lucrative. She has deals with Gucci, Adidas, PlayStation, Beats by Dr Dre and last month was gifted an MGS5 EV car, which she proudly showed off on Instagram. A regular at London Fashion Week, Alessia, 26, has appeared on the cover of magazines such as Women's Health. The BAFTA TV Awards in May saw her in a Â£1,295 Roland Mouret dress, right. BURBERRY CLAD GOALIE BURBERRY HANNAH Hampton - the longhaired goalkeeper with the girl-next-door looks - certainly has big shoes to fill after Mary Earps surprisingly announced her retirement from the squad last month. The 24-year-old Chelsea player has posed in Burberry for Elle magazine and counts Nike and Extra chewing gum among her corporate sponsors. She also works with Birmingham Children's Hospital after enduring numerous eye operations as a child to cure a squint. Hannah was told she would never be a professional sports player. ' I've gone through life proving people wrong,' she said recently, words that inspired devotion among her 228,000 Instagram followers. Her relationship status isn't known. DUBAI DEVOTEE SHE never travels without her Louis Vuitton luggage, can often be seen posing in a Maybach car, and enjoys swanky trips to Dubai, staying at the luxury Five resort there. Chelsea star Lauren James, 23, has treated herself to some of the finer things in life since her key role in the Lionesses' 2023 World Cup campaign. While her relationship status isn't known, she's close to her older brother Reece, who plays for the Chelsea men's team. She has commercial deals with Nike, Google Pixel, Optimum Nutrition, Sure deodorant and Walkers. The superstar siblings often attend red carpet events together. But while she is reportedly on Â£350,000 a year at Chelsea, Reece earns Â£250,000 a week. KOOKY STYLE SO DEVOTED is she to tattoos that midfielder Georgia Stanway, 26, not only has around 100 of her own inkings, but she's also learned to tattoo other people. The Bayern Munich star's kooky style has won her sponsors including Nike and an advertising deal with Celsius drinks, who featured on her Instagram page, where she has 433,000 followers. Off the pitch, she's been with Toulouse rugby league player Olly Ashall-Bott since 2022....

â€‰ The Uttar Pradesh government is taking its investment pitch global, anchoring a 'China+1' strategy to position the state as a dependable alternative for companies seeking to diversify supply chains. Under the banner of Invest UP, high-level roadshows and business roundtables will be held in New York, San Francisco, Los Angeles, London, Paris, Frankfurt, Milan, Amsterdam and Birmingham, in partnership with Indian embassies and industry bodies such as USIBC, CII and FICCI. In the United States, discussions will target technology heavyweights like Google, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure and Oracle, as well as datacenter operators Equinix and consumer brands including Skechers, Mattel, Ralph Lauren and Coach. In Europe and the UK, the outreach focuses on automotive and engineering leaders BMW, Bosch and BASF, luxury houses Prada and Versace, and consumer staples firms such as Lego, Unilever and GSK. Chief Secretary Manoj Kumar Singh said these engagements go beyond mere investment invitations, aiming to build sustainable, employment-driven value chains. Backed by over 33 sector-specific policies, streamlined approvals and the digital single-window platform Nivesh Mitra, UP recorded the highest number of new factory registrations in India in 2024-25, he noted. Singh highlighted recent marquee investments: a 3,700 crore semiconductor and electronics facility by HCL-Foxconn OSAT; the establishment of a Prime Minister's MITRA mega textile park alongside ten mini clusters; the 2023 EV policy targeting 36 GWh of battery capacity by 2028; and the development of Noida-Greater Noida as a national hub for data centres and AI infrastructure. Together, these initiatives set Uttar Pradesh on course to become a global manufacturing and innovation powerhouse. The Indian Express (P) Ltd

â€‰ SPR_COMBO[id]Liputan6.com, Jakarta - Ketika Oasis memulai tur reuni yang telah lama ditunggu-tunggu pada Jumat, 4 Juli 2025, dengan menggelar konser pembuka di Cardiff, Wales, merek-merek fesyen diperkirakan akan merapat memberi "dukungan." Hubungan yang secara historis retak antara Liam dan Noel Gallagher tidak hanya akan menghasilkan pertunjukan gemilang, namun emosional. Maka itu, menjangkau khalayak luas dan memanfaatkan gelombang nostalgia Britpop tahun 90-an untuk penjualan yang lebih tinggi seharusnya dilakukan paraÂ brandÂ fesyen,Â menurutÂ kolumnisÂ Andrea Felsted, dikutip dari Bloomberg, Sabtu, 5 Juli 2025. Acara musik, terutama tur, selain perilisan album terkenal, seperti Cowboy Carter milik Beyonce dan Brat milik Charli XCX tahun lalu, telah jadi fenomena budaya. Levi Strauss & Co bekerja sama dengan Beyonce setelah lagunya "Levii's Jeans," mengubah nama Instagram-nya sebentar menjadi "Levii's" dan meminta bintang tersebut untuk kampanye iklan. Banyak brand fesyen, termasuk Kate Spade milik Coach Inc., merangkul Brat. Sementara itu, desainer, termasuk Roberto Cavalli, Versace, dan Tiffany & Co. milik LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton SE mendandani Taylor Swift. Kini, para pengecer berbondong-bondong mengikuti apa yang disebut sebagai "Wonderwall Summer."Â  Merek mewah asal Inggris Burberry Group Plc jadi yang terdepan. Meski tidak secara eksplisit terkait dengan tur tersebut, kampanye Burberry Festival menampilkan Liam Gallagher dan kedua putranya, Lennon dan Gene Gallagher, serta putrinya Molly Moorish-Gallagher. Dorongan pemasaran ini mengingatkanÂ publikÂ pada masa kejayaan Burberry di tahun 1990-an. Kampanye terbaru memang menampilkan musisi Goldie, serta para pesohorÂ perempuan:Â Cara Delevingne dan Alexa Chung, tapi Liam adalah bintang utamanya. Ia mengenakan parka Burberry miliknya sendiri dari tahun 2018, yang akan diterbitkan ulang dalam edisi terbatas. Adidas AG lebih terbuka dalam menarik penggemar Oasis, dengan memproduksi koleksi dari co-branded clothing, yang dijual secara daring dan di toko-toko Adidas, serta Oasisinet.com, situs resminya, dan di stadion selama tur. Di antara nama-nama lain yang terlibat adalah Levi's, yang membuat serangkaian kaus oblong, dan Stone Island milik Moncler SpA, yang menampilkan Liam dalam kampanye musim gugurnya. Band rock pria, kataÂ Felsted, berarti audiensnya beragam, yang berguna untuk penjualan pakaian pria dan wanita. Menurut GlobalData, pasar pakaian dan alas kaki pria sekitar dua pertiga dari ukuran pakaian wanita, menjadikannya peluang yang signifikan. Meski ketertarikan yang terus berlanjut terhadap segala hal yang berbau tahun 90-an telah memperkenalkan Oasis pada generasi baru, hampir setengah dari mereka yang hadir telah menyaksikan konser band tersebut sebelumnya, menurut laporan Belanja Konsumen Barclays Plc. Mengingat bahwa Gallagher bersaudara belum pernah tampil bersama sejak 2009, hal itu menyiratkan demografi yang lebih tua, yang sering kali berarti kelompok yang memiliki uang untuk dibelanjakan pada kegiatan rekreasi.Â  Ini juga membantu bahwa banyak gaya yang dikenakan band tersebut. Di antaranya adalah elana jins longgar, kaus sepak bola, dan sepatu kets low-rise yang kembali jadi tren berkat apa yang disebut estetika "Blokecore." Sementara Swifties mungkin telah memilih payet dan Beyhive dengan topi koboi, penggemar Oasis tampaknya berfoya-foya dengan parka dan topi bucket.Â  Meski panasnya musim panas, rata-rataÂ unggahanÂ  TikTok mingguan yang menampilkan parka naik 188 persen antara 1 Juni dan 1 Juli, dibandingkan dengan bulan sebelumnya, menurut perusahaan intelijen pasar Trendalytics. Pencarian parka di pasar barang bekas Depop naik 1.850 persen pada Juni 2025, dibandingkan dengan periode tahun sebelumnya. Topi bucket juga punya daya tarik tersendiri. Menurut penelitian Barclays, hampir sepertiga penggemar yang menghadiri konser berencana mengenakan busana bergaya tahun 90-an, dan untuk mendorong perusahaan yang bekerja sama, lebih dari seperlima berencana mengenakan co-branded item. Pembelian tersebut akan menyumbang 1,06 miliar pound sterling (sekitar Rp23,4 trilioun) yang diharapkan akan dibelanjakan penggemar Oasis Inggris secara keseluruhan, menurut Barclays. Angka ini mencakup tiket, akomodasi, serta biaya makanan dan minuman. Oasis sendiri tidak selalu memiliki hubungan yang mudah dengan dunia mode. Liam memulai Pretty Green pada 2009, tapi lini tersebut diakuisisi JD Sports Fashion Plc tahun 2019. Tiga tahun kemudian, JD menjualnya pada pesaingnya Frasers Group Plc. Namun, peritel yang dikendalikan Mike Ashley tersebut tidak lagi memiliki label tersebut.

â€‰ After three years of dating, Scarlett Johansson and Colin Jost married in 2020 and welcomed their first child together in 2021. They've now been married for nearly four years and seem to still going strong. Both Johansson and Jost were big stars before they started dating and have only gotten more famous and successful since. Here's Jost and Johansson's complete relationship history so far, from their differing stories on how they met to where they're at today. 2006 The couple remember when they first met differently, and it seems like Jost may have been taken with the Ghost World actress long before she noticed him. He told Entertainment Tonight â€œThe first time she hosted was the first year I was a writer on the show,â€ he claimed. â€œSo, we've kind of known each other since thenâ€¦she's the best.â€ In his memoir, A Very Punchable Face, Jost doubled down on his timeline, writing he immediately noted her as being â€œbeautiful, smart, sweet, and intimidatingly sophisticatedâ€ and for having â€œa grace and a smile that I've still never seen in any other human.â€ â€œShe has just turned 20, and I was 23, but in terms of status and maturing she was here [holds hand above head] and I was here [holds hand one inch off ground],â€ he continued. â€œShe claims that she remembers thinking I was 'cute,' but I know what I looked like and that's not the word I would have used. ('Shaggy' would have been generous. ' Slovenly,' more accurate).â€ He added that he wrote a line for a My Sweet Sixteen sketch Johansson starred in that night. â€œThe only line I remember from the sketch is when Scarlett's bratty character says, 'This party is literally worse than the Holocaust.' That was my Shakespearean sonnet for the woman I would one day fall in love with,â€ Jost joked. 2010 On her end, Johansson says she remembers Jost from 2010, when she hosted SNL yet again. The actress was placed in a parody of 16 and Pregnant. â€œIt was some dumb parody that he had written, and he was in there partly directing this segment we had to do,â€ she told The Hollywood Reporter. At the time, Johansson was married to Ryan Reynolds. They divorced a month later in December 2010. March 2017 Johansson went on to marry French journalist Romain Dauriac, with whom she shares a daughter named Rose. In March 2017, the former couple had split, and Johansson had filed for divorce. She was slated to host SNL for a fifth time, and Jost was also single. Still, a source told E! at the time of her second divorce that Johansson was not ready to date. â€œScarlett just got separated from Romain and is still dealing with the fact that now she's had two failed serious relationships,â€ the source said. â€œShe's not trying to rush into anything and is just chilling.â€ May 2017 In May, Johansson played Ivanka Trump in SNL's season finale. Page Six reported that Johansson and Jost were seen together, and she was definitely noticing him. â€œScarlett and Colin were making out at the bar at the SNL season finale party at 30 Rock,â€ said a source. â€œThey would make out a bit, then go back to talking. They were at the bar in front of everyone...they made out at least twice...Then they went back to talking and hanging with other people.â€ A second source told E! News â€œSaturday night wasn't the first time,â€ the insider continued. â€œIt's been going on for a bit.â€ They added that things were â€œfun and casual...They like each other, but it's not exclusiveâ€”at least not at this point.â€ June 2017 The following month, they were spotted at The East Pole on New York City's Upper East Side, seemingly having an intimate dinner. July 2017 They were seen again the next month, this time on a getaway for the Fourth of July weekend in Montauk, New York. A source speaking to Us Weekly Another insider told E!, â€œThey are still getting to know each other, but she is really into him, and it's getting more on the exclusive level. Scarlett says he is different than many of the men she has been with. She is pretty picky who she goes out with even if it's just dating. They share many similarities together.â€ September 2017...

The victim was treated by the emergency services for knife injuries. Despite the best efforts of medics from London Ambulance Service, he died. A force spokesman said: â€œHis next-of-kin have been informed and are being supported by specialist officers. â€œA crime scene is in place while police investigate the circumstances.â€ Two men, aged 33 and 35, were arrested at the scene on suspicion of murder. reported the landlord told tennants in a note: â€œThe police are presently on the premises, diligently managing the situation. â€œWe would like to assure you that the building is secure, and there is no cause for concern with your safety. â€œAs a precautionary measure, the police have requested that the elevators be temporarily unavailable while they conduct their investigation.â€ According to its owners, DAMAC Tower â€œoffers the ultimate in branded living experiences with interiors by renowned luxury design house, Versace Home. â€œArtistic director, Donatella Versace, has considered every design detail.â€ It boasts 8,000 square feet of communal gardens, an indoor swimming pool and jacuzzi, state-of-the-art gym, cinema room, children's play area and 24-hour concierge. Detective Inspector Aytac Necati, leading the investigation, said: â€œSadly, a man has lost his life in the most horrendous of circumstances. Our thoughts are with his family and friends at this difficult time. â€œWe understand the effect this will have on the local community, and will ensure that officers are deployed on reassurance patrols to respond to any questions or concerns. â€œTwo men have already been arrested. â€œDetectives are working hard to establish the circumstances of what happened. â€œAt this time, we are not looking for anyone else in connection with this incident.â€

â€‰ Donatella bids farewell with archives, supermodels and classic codes that sum up three decades at the helm of Versace. Donatella Versace, designer, entrepreneur and symbol of the brand, bids farewell to her position by reuniting the key figures who defined the house's imaginary. Versace's Fall 2025 campaign is not just a collection; it is a statement of affection. The campaign features Claudia Schiffer, Kate Moss, Amber Valletta, Kristen McMenamy, Natasha Poly, Saskia de Brauw, Anok Yai, Liu Wen, Mica ArgaÃ±araz, Mila Van Eeten and Jacqui Hooper. All of them, wrapped in metal, archive and silhouettes portrayed by Mert & Marcus. 'Every collection is a story, and this is the story of Versace,' said Donatella. There is no nostalgia. There is narrative. What you see in this campaign is an intimate farewell that is not meant to be tragic, but celebratory. And among the eternal codes of the house's clothes, the liquid metal and the impossible waists, the new Virtus bag appears, called to be the symbol of this new stage. All this comes after months of speculation, confirmed this year with the purchase of Versace by the Prada Group for 1.25 billion euros. And with it, the appointment of Dario Vitale as the new creative director. The changeover is now official. Even so, Donatella, far from leaving, will continue as Versace's global ambassador.

â€‰ Versace Fall Winter 2025, Courtesy of Versace Donatella Versace's final campaign for the House that bears her name has arrived. With the Fall Winter 2025 visuals, the iconic designer delivers a parting message steeped in emotion, legacy, and unmistakable glamour. â€œBe yourself. Believe in yours. Break the rules,â€ she declares, an ethos that has defined her reign and now becomes its closing refrain. Photographed by Mert & Marcus , the campaign unites familiar faces and signature styles. Claudia Schiffer , Kate Moss , Kristen McMenamy , Amber Valletta , Natasha Poly , Saskia de Brauw , Liu Wen , Mica ArgaÃ±araz , Anok Yai, Mila Van Eeten and Jacqui Hooper return in looks that straddle both the past and present. Archival pieces, like the label's metallic mesh, appear alongside newer designs, including the Virtus bag adorned with the V-emblem. The collection reaffirms Donatella's long-standing fascination with contrasts: strength and sensuality, armor and elegance, control and chaos. Versace Fall Winter 2025, Courtesy of Versace The visuals are saturated in gold, casting a literal glow on the designer's final statement. According to Donatella, this campaign was about more than fashion: â€œThe energy on this campaign was extraordinary. It was all about friendship, loyalty, and love.â€ Her parting words extend beyond the clothes, shaping the tone of a legacy rooted in bold femininity and fearless attitude. Over the years, Donatella championed unapologetic glamour while pushing boundaries for women in fashion. Each of her collections told a story, of power, seduction, rebellion, and this final campaign threads those stories together into one cohesive narrative. It becomes both a retrospective and a vision for the future, positioning the Versace woman not as a figure of the past, but as a timeless presence with unstoppable force. Versace Fall Winter 2025, Courtesy of Versace As Donatella steps down, Versace enters a new era under Dario Vitale , formerly of Miu Miu. While all eyes are now on what comes next, this final campaign stands as a culmination of one of fashion's most formidable creative tenures, an unapologetic farewell that reflects the House's past while daring it to evolve. â€‰ Is #Antitrust Fashionable This Season? Find out the answer to this and other questions about recent antitrust activity in the #fashion and #luxury industries on this week's episode of the AmericanBarAssociation Antitrust Law Section's Our_Curious_Amalgam podcast, on which I had the privilege of being interviewed by Jeny Maier and Puja Patel. What happens when antitrust law meets high fashion? In episode 333, experienced fashion and luxury industry counsel Andowah Newton, joins Jeny Maier of Axinn, Veltrop & Harkrider and Puja Patel of ClearyGottlieb to unpack recent antitrust cases in the luxury and fashion industries. From the #FTC's challenge to Tapestry's (Coach katespadeny StuartWeitzman) attempted $8.5B acquisition of Caprii_Holdings (MichaelKors JimmyChoo Versace), toâ€¦ "No-poach" & â€œno-hireâ€ claims against Saks, BrunelloCucinelli_brand, Gucci, LoroPiana, LouisVuitton, and Prada), toâ€¦ "Tying" claims against HermÃ¨s and its coveted #Birkin bag, we explore how #competition law is colliding with market definition, exclusivity, #branding, and status. Listen in for insights on how antitrust enforcersâ€”and the courtsâ€”are approaching consolidation, labor & employment practices, and sales tactics in industries where scarcity sells. Thank you, Jeny, for inviting me to be a guest, Puja, #RiversideFM, and everyone at #ABA who helped put this podcast episode together!
